thread.title: Body Worn Camera Data Storage: The Gorilla in the Room
thread.title_full: Body Worn Camera Data Storage: The Gorilla in the Room

title: Body Worn Camera Data Storage: The Gorilla in the Room
text:
10 Body Worn Camera Data Storage: The Gorilla in the Room 
Government Technology: When the Chula Vista, Calif., Police Department started giving body worn cameras to a handful of police officers, they quickly learned that a 30-minute video took about 800 MB of storage space. The department crunched the numbers and realized that if it equipped every one of its 200 sworn officers with cameras, they could potentially generate 33 terabytes of data every year, according to Police Chief Magazine.
